column4: I am reading this blog post about adding empathy to the run on startup. I get "sudo cp /usr/share/applications/empathy.desktop /etc/xdg/autostart
but I don't understand why the FAQ is telling me to follow up with sudo chmod a+r /etc/xdg/autostart/empathy.desktop"
The first command added it to the startup listing already, the second..is telling the startup manager to read all the files again? What am I missing about it.
